sect2.title: Shuffling Data
sect2.para: With data shuffling tool you can shuffle data in a given cell range. The tool can be started by selecting ``Shuffle'' menu item in ``Data'' menu. In order to use the tool give the input range in which the data to be shuffled is stored. The tool is able to shuffle the contents of the whole cell range, or, also shuffle data according to rows or columns. The shuffling method is selected under the ``Input Range'' entry. For example, if your data is grouped by rows then select ``Shuffle Method'' ``Rows''.

The default output method is to shuffle in-place. The shuffled data can also be written into a new sheet, new workbook, or into an existing sheet by giving the output range. If you select the ``Autofit Columns'' option, the width of each output column is automatically fixed according to the size of data in it.
